name: Tendo
headline: Enabling Africans to sell online with zero capital
description:
Tendo enables anyone in Africa to sell online with zero upfront inventory - our mobile app connects dropshippers to local wholesalers. The sellers on the platform are able to source products through Tendo and resell items using social commerce tools, such as WhatsApp, arrange delivery, and get paid, all through the Tendo mobile app.

At the moment, people who want to sell online need to save money, visit hundreds of suppliers to find a trusted one, and risk losing their capital by stocking up inventory. Beyond this, they need to incur costs for logistics and warehousing. We eliminate all that.

founders.name: Evans Darbo Boateng, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder at Tendo | Software Engineer | 6+ years | Building Global Startups

generated_description:
**Tendo: Empowering Online Sellers in Africa**

Founded in 2021, Tendo is a Ghana-based startup that’s shaking up the e-commerce landscape in Africa. The company’s mission is simple but powerful: to enable Africans to sell online without needing any upfront capital. That's right—zero inventory costs, no need for logistics headaches, and no expensive warehousing fees. More importantly, it helps individuals bypass the agonizing process of saving money for product stock before they can even start selling.

At its core, Tendo serves as an innovative marketplace connecting dropshippers with local wholesalers through a user-friendly mobile app. This makes it easy for anyone in Africa to source products at wholesale prices, add their profit margin, and sell directly through social media platforms, primarily leveraging WhatsApp. Once a sale is made, Tendo handles the delivery and processes payments, putting money in the seller’s pocket without any financial risk upfront.

Tendo is not just another e-commerce platform; it’s a vehicle for entrepreneurship. Users can start their online businesses right from their homes, with reported earnings of around 1000 cedis per month. This model empowers people from all walks of life—including students and professionals—to tap into the online marketplace hustle without traditional start-up costs.

Currently, Tendo operates out of Accra, Ghana, and employs a dedicated team of 15. It’s also a proud member of Y Combinator’s W22 batch, an essential accelerator that underscores its growth potential. With a backing group partner like Nana, Tendo is poised for exciting developments ahead.

Their website, [tendo.app](https://tendo.app/), is where all the action happens. Interested in becoming a reseller or a supplier? The process is immediate and straightforward. Tendo not only welcomes budding entrepreneurs but also invites suppliers to list their products on the platform, making Tendo a comprehensive marketplace.

With tags like ‘fintech,’ ‘marketplace,’ ‘logistics,’ ‘social,’ and ‘e-commerce,’ it’s clear that Tendo is not just building a platform; it’s facilitating an ecosystem of support for African sellers. The future looks bright, as they continue to expand the accessibility of online selling across the continent, truly democratizing e-commerce in Africa.
